column2: Jenna, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Caregiver)
column9: I have only been on this pill for about 2 weeks. I'm taking it for menstrual irregularities and acne. I read these reviews and got scared. I considered not taking Cryselle. But I'm glad I tried it anyway. My skin is not greasy, I'm not moody, I got a breakout at first but now I have no acne at all-my skin is actually clearer, my ankles don't swell as much as other pills, and I'm happy with it overall. Granted, it's only been 2 weeks. I just wanted to write a positive review to show women that what works for some women is awful for others. You just have to try it for yourself! If you're wondering if you should try Cryselle, I would suggest it. It is monophasic-meaning it has the same amount of estrogen and progestin in each pill. This way, the hormones don't fluctuate throughout the cycle. (Which is what caused my breakouts on other pills.) Just try it for yourself and see how you like it!

column2: pleiwithlei, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I switched from Ortho-Evra to Cryselle about 10 months ago. My doctor explained about the breakthrough bleeding especially if I was going to use it to skip periods. However, due to interactions with other medications (mainly absorption the of Cryselle), I have just experienced a month-long period and have now broken out with acne from chin to shoulders to back. I'm pretty sure this is not due to the other medications because I have taken them before with no problems. Cryselle is my newest medication and I've narrowed my symptoms down to it. I have also stopped my other meds but my acne still persists. I even did my laundry three times over to make sure. I added benzoyl peroxide to my skin regimen and when that didn't help and then also added salicylic acid. Still no change. I will have to go see my dermatologist because of this and I have NEVER broken out past my chin in acne. I have never had bad acne in my life. I am also having problems with weight gain. I don't eat too bad of a diet, but I've gained about 10 lbs since my breakthrough bleeding started. I have tried to offset that by exercising more (I'm on my feet running all day at my job and added 15-20min of cardio 5days a week) and eating even more healthy (more salad bleh and I don't drink anything but water, tea, or coffee), but it feels impossible to lose. I work in nursing and in pharmacy so I know what most of the side effects are and that they are different for everyone, but this one has by far given me the worst side effects in the 12 years I've been on bc when it's not been used properly (ie the med interactions). I will probably switch to another bc when my year is up.

column9: Has anyone had any vision changes with this one?  Blurriness?  I have also lost more than half of the hair on my head.  Bled almost every day with this one for months, then, it magically stopped.  Let me know if anyone out there has had any vision changes.  Thanx!

column2: Diva Dee, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I just started this drug a month ago. For the first 2 weeks of taking these pills i felt sick to my stomach, I craved food and ate all day. This drug made me bleed heavily for a full 30 days. my menstrual cycle began soon after (and i only know that because it was accompanied by cramps). Now i have to wait 7 days to determine if the month long bleeding will stop. i am fearful that i may have turned anemia and started taking iron supplements as a precaution.

column2: WhiGru, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I was on Cryselle for 2+ years up until 3 weeks ago (now TTC). Went on it for cramps/long-heavy periods/and bc. Did not gain noticible weight but I was on other BCs for 4 years before this one so maybe I just didnt notice. Worked great, prevented pregnancy, somewhat shorter/lighter periods, and was able to skip them if I wanted. Also very predictable- knew when my period would come every month! However, going off has been terrible! Breaking out on face/back/chest, moody and depressed! Big increase in oil on my face/head- not happy! From other reviews I've read, this will hopefully go away soon...fingers crossed.

column2: Jenna, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been on this pill for about 4 months and take it without breaks so as not to have a cycle. I had some spotting in the 2nd month but none since then. I am now experiencing mystic acne on my chin and neck. I tried Yaz prior to and it was a bad experience. It caused spotting and severe breast pain. I don't think any pill is perfect.

column2: amc1227, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: My acne got so much worse not only on my face but back and shoulders too...It made my sex drive very low..I wish I never started this pill my face is horrible

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am literally on day 4 of Cryselle. I was previously on Tri-Sprintec for roughly one year.I just had a physical (pap, blood, etc) and I described to my doctor that during the last month or two, I've had pain during sex in a few positions (me on top-my favs and that's not normal to me!) and also right under my belly button on the right side felt tighter on the inside. She referred me to get a pelvic ultrasound and suprise suprise!! I have a cyst inside my right ovary. Not on top, but inside. Not as common. So at least I have explanation as to why the discomfort. Needless to say I have a follow up in 6 weeks to see if the cyst has dissintegrated or increased in size. I read another review that Cryselle is used to help control the ovarian cysts. I am HOPING that it does. Other than that, I hope that this is effective in preventing pregnancy, won't cause crazy mood swings and does not flair up any ance. Just an FYI: I was on a pill with higher androgen (male hormones) levels and I had a HUGE sex drive and a HUGE flair up of acne. I decided to switch because the acne outweighed the sex drive. It was hoestly the worst it's ever been.. even at 14!!! Best of luck to everyone.. We woman must go through a lot by preventing pregnancies!! The mood swings, irregular bleeding, lack of sex drive, weight gain, nausea, ovarian cysts, depression, etc.. TOO MUCH!! I keep trying to convince my love of 2 yrs to get a vasectomy, but until we have our kids one day, that request is not happening. Ce la vie!

I started taking this about 6 months ago and since I have become very moody and stressed more than normal. I lost ALL sex drive. I also was constantly feeling bloated. I was not happy at all with how this drug made me feel.

column2: Casper, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I tried to hang in there through the side effects, but had to stop this pill after 6 weeks. With Cryselle, I had worse migraines, non-migraine pounding headaches, 10 lb weight gain in 6 weeks, acne in weird places (low back, legs, chest), water retention (puffy face), moodiness, and scary painful muscle/body aches. Going to talk to GYN about non-hormone birth control options.

column2: amasol, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I was on Cryselle for 6 months and I'm sorry I didn't switch off it sooner. It made me extremely moody, emotionally unstable, and even depressed. For the first 3 months it gave intense stomach pain after taking it, though taking it with yogurt seemed to help. The worst was my sex drive decreased drastically. Soon as I switched to a different brand, my libido was up again and it's been wonderful being off Cryselle!

column2: tmh, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I love this medication; have never had any negative side effects

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I really like this pill. At first my face got all oily and I was nausious for about a day, but that all went away. I noticed my face began to clear up more. I have clearer skin now and regular periods.I have not gained any weight or have had changes in mood. I am very happy woth this pill.

column2: sillygirl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I had a lighter, shorter period, but that was not enough to put up with the downsides...very moody before period, lots of acne breakouts on my face, felt emotionally unstable- have tried different bc methods for 12 yrs now & Cryselle has been the worst experience- more worse than my allergic reaction to Yaz where I needed two forms of steroids to counter the reaction.

column2: cejkalady, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Since I started taking it, I have had lighter, shorter periods, less acne, and less mood swings. My breasts got larger, but no other weight gain noticed. My only qualm was that my sex drive decreased, and if you don't want to have sex, there's not much reason for b/c except for medical reasons!

column2: lauuu, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I've been taking this for one month, and have had trouble sleeping through the night. Every morning I wake up with a head ache, and yesterday I got my period and have been extremely moody crying over everything, and today I've had a horrible head ache all day...I've taken two different types of birth control before and never had any symptoms (except for weight gain). I think I will switch to yaz.

column2: daisygirl, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months
column9: felt to be retaining alot of water

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have used this BC for about 3 1/2 months, and am not satisfied. I have had bad breakouts on my back (never had before) and chest, and a lot of weight gain. I have also been extremely tired, as another user commented, and have had bad mood swings.

column2: ia28, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is the first birth control medication I have ever been on. The only reason my gyno put me on it is due to endometriosis and periods every other week with heavy bleeding and extreme pain. I just finished my first pack and so far I am very happy with how Cryselle has helped. I had no pain associated with my period, they are extremely light, and my headaches have completely gone away. I have also noticed I am happy and not as moody and short with people as before. Also, this brand of birth control cost me less than $5 a month which is a huge plus.I think weight gain could be possible with this birth control, but I have not experienced any. I began working out the first day of taking the pill. If you exercise and just watch what you are eating, weight gain will not be an issue at all. The only side effect I have noticed is chest acne and bad acne on my chin. I broke out a lot though before my period when I was not on Cryselle, so this is still not much worse than before. I did get very emotional and cry a lot for the first month. I am hoping everything will regulate its self out by month 3 because Cryselle is really helping my periods and endometriosis.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: for the past few weeks (ive been on it for two weeks altogether now, just started my third week today) and i am tired all the time, the back and chest are breaking out, and i feel like throwing up.  im not sure if i gained weight, i don't see how i could since im not eating because i feel sick!  my daughter is 5 and i can't stay awake with her and i feel sick all the time.  i get up in the morning and go right back to sleep in just a couple hours and sleep all day.  I dislike this pill, i was on tri cyclin for well over 7 years and switched becauyse my dr wanted me on lower dosage of hormones.  Im going to the dr tomorrow to get a new script.

column2: Jenny4, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been on this medication for about 4 years now. It worked in the beginning with little side effects. Now it seems that is causing some depression/moodiness. I didn't notice weight gain, but I did notice some unwanted hair on my chin that I could go without for sure. I will probably try some other pill and see how that works for me.

column2: maskjs,  Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have been taking this for 2 years, no weight gain, no moodiness, lighten/shortened period. Very happy wit this bc.

column2: 19-24 on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years
column9: Been taking this bc for almost 8 years. Started taking it because of cysts in my ovaries, and now for actual birth control. Havent gotten pregnant yet. No weight gain. I'm moodier when I'm off it than when I'm on it.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: Have been on this pill for about a year now, after having been on Yasmin for 6 years and began to have very irregular bleeding. Main negative is a definite worsening of my acne. I had it completely controlled on the Yasmin, but found myself breaking out horribly on my back, arms, chest, and face (but only around my period). Am on another oral med just to help control the acne now. Otherwise, I really like it! Increased sex drive, larger breasts, no weight gain...I can deal with taking another med for the acne it caused to have all of the benfits of this pill. Very Happy!!

column2: cindy, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years
column9: it worked for a while

column2: mom of 2, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i have only been on this birth control for 3 weeks and i have been scared for the past week because of nausea and breast tenderness. the first signs of pregnancy. as i read these comments i am relieved to hear it affects others the same way. i just hope next week i get my period, then i will feel better. i am switching from yasmin because i can not afford it anymore. i hope it will be worth all the bad feelings.

column2: swanindisguise86, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have used this b/c for about 2-3 years and found that I gained weight very fast once started. I never used to have mood swings until later on. It was only a few days before my period that I would have them but they increased in severity over time. I stopped taking them for 3 months and felt completly normal right away. However, I hate condoms and I am with the same person for 2 1/2 years now and we plan to get married but don't want kids. Until he can get a vasectomy I have decided that I will take the take the mood swings over the parania about getting pregnant. I didn't have any break through bleeding on this pill but tried Othrotricyclin for a few months and bled for about 3 months stright with frequent spotting between my periods. I feel this pill works very well, I never had any pregnancy scares while taking it. I was able to lose most of the weight I gained with some disipline and better eating habits so it's not impossible to manage your weight on this pill. If the mood swings return I may try another pill but I'm hoping this break might have done the trick for a little while.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Increased vaginal fluid is an understatement

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I just started this medication.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I've started taking this pill and had my period for about 7 days now and my period has been heavy all seven days! I'm on my 8th day and I still have my period, but not as heavy...I should have been done 4 days ago!

column2: smashly, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: When i first took this drug i had nausea every day, a friend told me to try taking it right before bed as soon as i did that the nausea has not been back. My periods are now regular and so far it has been very effective...

column2: 25-34 Female  (Patient)
column9: Since I have been taking this drug I have experienced low sex drive, acne, breast tenderness, arm and leg numbness, and very bad mood swings.

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am taking 40 mg of Prozac as well and the effects of combining both together have been horrendous. I can not sleep and I become restless irritable hungry I feel like I have a horrible case of ADD. before when I was just on Prozac I was fine. Cryselle is supposed to be a very low dosage; however I felt the hormonal change right away. I am going to discontinue.

column2: ready2beamom, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I take this for many reasons, but mainly to prevent painful periods & ovarian cysts. I've used this daily for almost 2 years & have been satisfied up until the last 4 months. Never before did I have breakthrough bleeding, but it's happened everyday since April (today is May 21). I've been celibate for 9 months so no STD concerns & yes I have been tested since abstaining. Also, after reading other comments I don't feel as weird knowing I'm not the only one who has developed unwanted facial hairs! My weight fluctuates regularly anyway, so not sure if this bcp is helps or hurts. It definitely helps with pregnancy prevention though...when I had sex it was unprotected quite often with my boyfriend & never got pregnant. Hope my review helps someone out there.

column2: no kids yet thanks pill, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I've been on Cryselle for almost four years and it has regulated my period.  I get one every month same time.  I have noticed excessive hair on my neck and chin areas.  But if you don't want to get pregnant the pill is not the only means that you should use.  Condoms and the pill for me have worked.  No children yet.  Never missed a pill or period.  I am satisfied with the pill.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: After you get used to the nausea and the feeling your throat is closing after you take the pill; you just have to deal with the oily skin, acne attacks, moodiness and weight gain...oh yeah, I GOT PREGNANT too (not a bad thing, just suprised..and I didn't miss a pill) and then miscarried (horrible, not sure if it had anything to do with the drug). This is by far the WORST birth-control I have ever used.

column2: shanna, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have taken this for about two weeks now. Like others I have noticed that I am moodier and naussiated all the time. My eating habits have changed and I still have not stopped my period. I have been on it for 2 and 1/2 weeks now. I was told it would stop it and regulate them better but so far it hasn't worked.

column2: s, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I've been on cryselle for about 7 years, since i had an irregular period. Everything was fine, except for the last 2 years.  I've become more moody and depressed and i've grown unwanted facial/ body hair, and i've gained weight. I think i want to change pills....

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I took this birth control stop the break-through bleeding when I wasn't suppose to be bleeding. It hasn't definitely lightened my periods but I also find my self nausous and my acne is pretty bad.

column2: tiredofbleeding, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Took this bc for 2 months for breakthrough bleeding, didn't work. 38 years old and caused acne like I was a teenager! Makes me nauseated also. Unless your wanting acne and stomach upset I DO NOT reccomend this!!

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this b/c for two months. It is effective in the sense that I did not get pregnant but I did experience other adverse side effects. Severe acne on my back, as well as break outs on my face and I have not had a problem with acne in years. Breast tenderness, unwanted facial hair, headaches and nausea were also experienced. Any b/c you may take reacts differently to different people. I believe the estrogen amount in this pill is too high for me, I'm going to ask for a lower dose pill.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have only been using this brand of birth control for 2 months and I am not happy at all my face and hair is oilier and my period is so unregular, I have weird spotting that can last up to a week so Im all confused as to which one is my real period, I have missed a period one month and had 2-3 in a nother with several pregnancy scares. Calling the doc to get something diffrent ASAP!

column2: vagirl305, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: Effective to prevent cysts on my ovaries, but I've gained weight since taking Cryselle. Doing the same exercise routine as before taking this pill, and my weight fluctuates like crazy! Of course, this is depressing. :(

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year
column9: It did its job, it prevented me from getting pregnant.  I do think it did effect my mood and caused me to become depressed and moody though.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)

column9: my only problem is weight gain.

column2: sheil, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
